intro: Grevillea nematophylla subsp. supraplana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and bright orange to red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
